availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry W. Bradford (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Ann Morris Bradford. Father of William Bradford, Mary Bradford, Stephen Bradford, and Rice Bradford. Farmer in Maury County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed James Sharp as a laborer in Marion County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Marion County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Maury County, District 13, p. 186A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 670.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 492A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Bradfordsville, p. 3B-4A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Births.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Marion County, KY, September 1863, p. 15.
"Henry White Bradford (1823-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #22433704, accessed December 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22433704.
